medical: CC: Fluctuating level of consciousness. HX: 59y/o male experienced a "pop" in his head on 10/10/92 while showering in Cheyenne, Wyoming. He was visiting his son at the time. He was found unconscious on the shower floor 1.5 hours later. His son then drove him Back to Iowa. Since then he has had recurrent headaches and fluctuating level of consciousness, according to his wife. He presented at local hospital this AM, 10/13/92. A HCT there demonstrated a subarachnoid hemorrhage. He was then transferred to UIHC. MEDS: none. PMH: 1) Right hip and clavicle fractures many years ago. 2) All of his teeth have been removed. FHX: Not noted. SHX: Cigar smoker. Truck driver. EXAM: BP 193/73. HR 71. RR 21. Temp 37.2C. MS: A&O to person, place and time. No note regarding speech or thought process. CN: Subhyaloid hemorrhages, OU. Pupils 4/4 decreasing to 2/2 on exposure to light. Face symmetric. Tongue midline. Gag response difficult to elicit. Corneal responses not noted. MOTOR: 5/5 strength throughout. Sensory: Intact PP/VIB. Reflexes: 2+/2+ throughout. Plantars were flexor, bilaterally. Gen Exam: unremarkable. COURSE: The patient underwent Cerebral Angiography on 10/13/92. This revealed a lobulated aneurysm off the supraclinoid portion of the left internal carotid artery close to the origin of the posterior communication artery. The patient subsequently underwent clipping of this aneurysm. He recovery was complicated severe vasospasm and bacterial meningitis. HCT on 10/19/92 revealed multiple low density areas in the left hemisphere in the LACA-LPCA watershed, left fronto-parietal area and left thalamic region. He was left with residual right hemiparesis, urinary incontinence, some (unspecified) degree of mental dysfunction. He was last seen 2/26/93 in Neurosurgery clinic and had stable deficits.
layman:
**Chief complaint:** The patient’s level of consciousness has been changing.

**History:** A 59‑year‑old man had a “pop” in his head while showering in Cheyenne, Wyoming on 10/10/92. He was visiting his son. He was found unconscious on the shower floor about 1½ hours later. His son drove him back to Iowa. Since then, his wife says he has had frequent headaches and his consciousness has been fluctuating. He went to the local hospital this morning (10/13/92). A head CT scan showed bleeding in the space around the brain (subarachnoid hemorrhage). He was then transferred to UIHC. He is not on any medications.  

**Past medical history:**  
1. He had fractures of the right hip and clavicle many years ago.  
2. All of his teeth have been removed.  

**Family history:** Not mentioned.  

**Social history:** He smokes cigars and works as a truck driver.  

**Physical exam:**  
- Blood pressure 193/73, heart rate 71, breathing 21, temperature 37.2 °C.  
- He is awake and aware of person, place, and time. No notes on his speech or thoughts.  
- Eye exam shows bleeding under the lens in both eyes. Pupils are 4 mm and get smaller to 2 mm when light is shone. Face is symmetrical. Tongue is in the middle. It was hard to get a gag reflex. Corneal reflexes were not checked.  
- Muscle strength is normal (5/5) in all limbs.  
- Sensation to pain and vibration is normal. Reflexes are 2+ in all limbs. Plantar reflexes are normal (downward).  
- Genital exam was normal.  

**Course:**  
On 10/13/92 he had a cerebral angiogram that found a lobulated aneurysm on the left internal carotid artery near the start of the posterior communicating artery. He had the aneurysm clipped. His recovery was complicated by severe narrowing of blood vessels (vasospasm) and bacterial meningitis. A head CT on 10/19/92 showed several low‑density spots in the left side of the brain, including the left front‑parietal area and left thalamus. He was left with weakness on the right side of his body, urinary incontinence, and some level of mental impairment. He was last seen in the neurosurgery clinic on 2/26/93 and his deficits were stable.
